passages.text: USA | Maritime Group
**Equity Research** August 28, 2025
2Q miss and earnings pass, Bumps dividend with cash stockpile

Excluding a sale gain, NAT reported an EPS loss of $0.04, missing expectations of $0.05, as drydockings negatively impacted revenue days. Its realized TCE of $26,880/day, also came in below expectations. Despite the miss and consecutive quarterly adjusted losses, it bumped its dividend to $0.10/sh from $0.07/sh in 1Q. It took delivery of two 2016-built Suezmaxes and completed the sale of one 2004-built Suezmax. We maintain our Hold rating and $3 target.

**2Q miss on lower rates and drydockings:** NAT reported breakeven EPS, though excluding a $7.1 million sale gain, adjusted EPS came in at a loss of $0.04 that missed consensus and our estimate of $0.05. Adjusted EBITDA of $15.8 million also missed consensus of $33.0 million and our modeled $33.6 million. NAT's combined fleet, inclusive of time charters, averaged $26,880/day in the quarter, sequentially stronger than the 1Q average of $24,714/day, but below our estimate of $31,600/day. NAT noted that several of its vessels underwent drydockings in the quarter, lowering available earning days. Additionally, the timing of the Nordic Castor sale and the delivery of the Nordic Moon and Nordic Galaxy into NAT's fleet likely impacted available operating days.

**The path forward for NAT:** NAT's fleet of 20 Suezmaxes, 6 of which are on time charter, continue to realize rates below index averages. Currently, Suezmaxes are the best performing tanker asset in the spot market with non-eco Suezmaxes averaging over $50,000/day and the ytd average just below $40,000/day. NAT's fleet age stands at 11.5 years, though 5 of its vessels are above the age of 20. We expect NAT to continue to renew its fleet, similar to its latest moves with the outgoing Nordic Castor (2004-built) and the Nordic Apollo (2003-built, sold in 1Q) having been replaced by the Nordic Moon and Nordic Galaxy, both of which are 2016-built. As NAT refines its fleet, we expect its realized TCE rate averages to improve. We are modeling a fleet-wide TCE average of $30,000/day for 3Q, bringing our EPS to $0.02.

**Cash position buying higher payouts:** Despite an earnings loss, NAT bumped its dividend to $0.10/sh, from $0.07 in 1Q, and marks its highest payout since 2Q24 when it paid out $0.12/sh. Its payout has become detached from earnings with 1H25 dividends totaling $0.17/sh comparing to a combined adjusted EPS ofs of $0.06. NAT's recent $150 million refinancing of its Beal Bank facility in 1Q boosted its each position by almost $80 million, as only $72 million went towards the retirement of its debt. Jended 2Q with $94.5 million in cash, compared to $39.2 million at the end of 2024, and its cash position could continue to be a cushion for a higher payout, while renewing its fleet through resale sales and replacing with newer ships.
**Maintain hold rating and** $3 price target: NAT's high payout has provided a backing to its share price with the shares trading at around 0.95x NAV. We remain Hold-rated with a $3 price target.

**Omar Nokta*|Equity Analyst**
**Jaeyoung McGarry*|Equity Associate**
**Emily Harkins*|Equity Associate**

NAT has focused exclusively on Suezmazes since its founding over 25 years ago and has aimed to keep a low breakeven and high dividend payout policy throughout much of its history. The past few years have been difficult for many shipowners, and NAT took several steps to strengthen its balance sheet, including refinancing its vessels, selling older ships, and issuing equity via ATMs. NAT now has a solid balance sheet and looks poised to benefit from stronger tanker market dynamics, though age of fleet is becoming a concern with one- third of its vessels built pre- 2010, which is having a noticeable impact on realized freight rates.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
- Prevailing ship values remain unchanged- OPEC production remains unchanged- Non-OPEC production increases gradually- Shares trade in line with NAV of \(\) 3\$

- Spot rates surge above breakeven levels- OPEC raises output faster than expected- Non-OPEC production increases sooner than projected- Global oil inventories remain at low levels- Iran sanctions lead to tighter tanker capacity- Secondhand ship values increase 25%- Shares trade in line with adjusted forward NAV, equal to \(\) 4.50\$

- Spot VLCC rates remain below breakeven for extended period- OPEC unable to maintain targets- Non-OPEC output growth slower than expected- Global oil inventories increase rapidly- Secondhand ship values decrease 25%- Shares trade at a 20% discount to our adjusted forward NAV, equal to \(\) 2\$

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Energy Management - NAT is committed to operating in accordance with the highest standards of quality and safety in the marine transportation industry. All of its Suezmax tankers are double- hulled, incorporating additional steel in areas subject to high stress. In addition, they have enhanced coating specifications to minimize corrosion and high- specification equipment and machinery to reduce maintenance and protect the environment. 2) Ecological impacts - NAT has committed to protecting and preserving resources, preventing pollution, and continually improving management. It also considers environmental issues and regulations in all design and development projects.
Company target: 1) Overall compliance with Carbon Intensity Indicator ratings, Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index ratings, and IMO net emissions- reduction targets by 2030.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) How do you expect your average CII rating to fare in relation to IMO requirements? 2) Are engines, roofs on conventionally fueled ships a viable option from a cost/return standpoint compared to ordering alternatively fueled newbuildings?
- 3Q25 earnings- Guidance on rates achieved- Upside to dividend

Nordic American is engaged in the transportation of crude oil utilizing its focused fleet of Suezmax tankers.

Our NAT price target is based on our assessment of the company's NAV, which could change meaningfully based on changes in prevailing vessel values. The tanker market is highly volatile, with spot rates changing on an ongoing daily and intraday basis due to tanker vessel supply and charterer demand changes. The sector is dependent on seaborne oil volumes, which historically are driven by OPEC and non- OPEC production. Should higher and/or lower oil volumes come to market, they could have a materially upward or downward impact on charter rates. Tanker newbuilding and secondhand prices are driven by charter rates and shipyard construction costs, with changes in steel and labor major factors in overall costs. Higher interest rates typically are associated with declining ship values while lower interest rates could lead to higher values. The changes in ship values, therefore, impact the balance sheet and various leverage ratios.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
